topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Deploying the VMware vSphere Distributed Switch

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in the KVM + ESX Deployment requires the VMWare vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS). The VDS provides a centralized interface from which you can configure, monitor and administer virtual machine access switching for the entire data center. You should have obtained the VDS installation package from VMware.
body.section:
Before starting, make sure your VSD server is up and running.
To install the VDS:
Log into your VSD server.
Install the RPM Package Manager (RPM) package management system. The RPM installation package is installed on your VSD host in the /opt/vsd/Packages/ directory..
Change to the /opt/vsd/Packages/ directory.
cd /opt/vsd/Packages/
Execute the following command:rpm â€“ivh CloudMgmt-vmware-3.2.4_134-1.x86_64.rpm
Change to the following directory:cd /opt/vsd/CloudMgmt-vmware/
Execute the following command, using appropriate values for the vCenter IP address, the vCenter user and password, and the ESX cluster name. The other values are static../cli.bash create_dvswitch --add-hosts true --num-portgroups 1 --provider-vdc-id 1 --url https://<vcenter ip>/sdk -u <vcenter user> -p <vcenter password> -r <cluster name>
